function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inconsistent information disclosure about the pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conflicting political views on pandemic response and impact","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective technical systems for coordinated public policies","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to take advantage of new technologies for implementing innovative governance models","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordination among different levels of public administrations","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Implementation of emerging technologies in early stages","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emphasis on strategic planning processes and the need for strategic alignment may overlook the specific measures needed to mitigate contagious diseases in the built environment.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Open government mechanisms may not adequately address the specific needs for implementing contagious disease mitigation strategies in strategic planning processes.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on the design of new governance models using emerging technologies ets to incorporate contagious disease mitigation strategies.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exclusion of papers not focused on smart governance models or disaster management models using emerging technologies","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of research stream on emerging technologies impact on disaster management or collaborative models of governance in smart cities.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid and global spread of a contagious
